intro: Tapura colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian tapura, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 15 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in well-drained soil and full sunlight.
